key_points: The Murder of Gabby Petito: Truth, Lies and Social Media is a documentary focusing on the tragic disappearance and death of Gabby Petito.
Gabby Petito disappeared in August 2021 during a road trip with her fiancé Brian Laundrie; her body was discovered on September 21, 2021, in Wyoming.
The cause of death was ruled as homicide, caused by manual strangulation.
The documentary features the first documentary interview with Gabby Petito's parents and step-parents.
It discusses the significant role of social media and internet sleuths in bringing attention to Gabby's case and aiding the investigation.
The documentary premiered in the U.S. on December 17 and is available exclusively on Peacock.
It explores Gabby Petito's life, her disappearance, and the subsequent discovery of her body, including the involvement of her fiancé Brian Laundrie.
Brian Laundrie was considered a person of interest in the investigation; his remains were found on October 20, 2021, and his death was ruled as suicide.
Social media and a video from the Bethune family's dashcam were pivotal in the case's investigation.
The documentary provides an in-depth timeline of the events, including interactions with law enforcement.
